frameDefinitions: A Producer produces a Product from a Resource for commercial purposes. '
A person (Speaker) expresses a Message or mental content, broadly understood, in a particular Manner.
An Agent causes an Impactor to make sudden, forcible contact with an Impactee, or manipulates two (or more) Impactors so that they make mutual forcible contact.
A salient Subevent has a Pattern of recurrence within a larger Process.
A Speaker communicates a message stating an Item's membership in a Category, i.e., asserts that the Item has the defining characteristics of the Category.
A Communicator publically communicates some difficult-to-express Content which they (or a social group of which they are a member) have had for some time.
frameExamples: They <t>produced</t> only half of the units after an injunction to follow the environmental policy.
He <t>slammed</t> his fist down on the table and bellowed something unintelligible.
Tony's fingers tapped <t>rhythmically</t> on the keyboard
He <t>depicted</t> his involvement as merely peripheral.
Those grievances can be <t>aired</t> during Board meetings. CNI
listRoleDefinitions: The person or company that produces the Product.
The <fen>Product</fen> is produced by the <fen>Producer</fen>.
<fen>Factory</fen> identifies the particular plant where the <fen>Product</fen> is manufactured.
This Fe identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the product was produced.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Product</fen> is manufactured.
<fen>Speaker</fen>, the person who encodes the <fen>Message</fen>, occurs as the External Argument of all the verbs:
The <fen>Message</fen> is almost invariably expressed in an NP Object. (The only exceptions occur with the verb <t>express</t>, which is occasionally used with that-clause complements.)

For most of the words in this frame, some expression of <fen>Manner</fen> or <fen>Medium</fen> is obligatory. As in other frames, <fen>Manner</fen> expressions characterize the action (in this case, the speech act performed by the <fen>Speaker</fen>). However, a wide range of <fen>Manner</fen> expressions occurs in this frame, including the following types:
<fen>Medium</fen> expresses the <fen>Medium</fen> of communication, such as the language used or the specific type of text in which the <fen>Message</fen> occurs:
The <fen>Impactee</fen> is the entity which is hit by the <fen>Impactor</fen>.
The <fen>Impactor</fen> is the entity that hits the <fen>Impactee</fen> because of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s efforts.
The <fen>Impactors</fen> are the multiple entities that collide.
The <fen>Agent</fen>  causes an impact.

The <fen>Cause</fen> marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, 
typically non-human, force that causes an <fen>Impactor</fen> to make sudden, 
forcible contact with an Impactee.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen>  when the impact occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The larger event that is characterized by the recurring Subevents.
The salient, punctual event that is construed as part of a <fen>Process</fen>.
The <fen>Pattern</fen> that can be detected in the recurrence of  the <fen>Subevent</fen>s of the <fen>Process</fen> .
The individual that communicates the message concerning the <fen>Category</fen> of an <fen>Item</fen>.
The class of entities with characteristics that match those of the <fen>Item</fen> according to the portrayal of the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Speaker</fen> portrays as belonging to a <fen>Category</fen>.
The piece of text in which a <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates their categorization of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The point in time at which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes a characterization of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Speaker</fen> characterizes the <fen>Item</fen>
The <fen>Communicator</fen> is the person who expresses the <fen>Content</fen> (whether spoken or written).
The attitude or feeling that the <fen>Communicator</fen> had not previously expressed.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the observable action or product of the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Content</fen> is communicated.
The role specifies the place where the communication takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>General Electric</fex> manufactures electronic appliances.
The company manufactured <fex>T-shirts</fex>.
Those machines were manufactured <fex>in the Miami plant</fex>.
Those cars were produced <fex>in 1997</fex>.
Those leather shoes were made <fex>in Italy</fex>.
<fex>The teacher</fex> phrased the question carefully.
The Prime Minister expressed <fex>her sympathy for the victims</fex>.
True Manner: You should phrase it <fex>carefully</fex>.
Kim formulated her objections <fex>in French</fex>.
What I want to know is who smacked <fex>my head</fex> with a 10-ton truck?
Those hoodlums strike my car <fex>with water balloons</fex> every day!
Mr. Addams likes to collide <fex>toy trains</fex> at high speed.
<fex>One juggler</fex> was hitting the ceiling with every other ball.
<fex>A violent explosion</fex>rattled the windows.
A postman rammed his Fiat Panda into a getaway car <fex>after spotting the burglars </fex> .
Father Shanahan , of Rushey Mead , Leicester , rammed his Datsun into another car <fex>on the way to the city 's Gilroes cemetery</fex>.
The rhythm <fex>of the rain falling on the roof</fex> kept me awake
His rhythmic <fex>tapping</fex> irritated her
The music had a driving rhythm
However, <fex>'A Brief History of Medicine'</fex> characterizes influenza as the most deadly plague, overall.
<fex>Reagan</fex> gave voice to the innate patriotism of the American people.
Members aired <fex>their grievances</fex> and resented the way higher education was being dealt with.
I do not especially espouse the ideas articulated by Diana Plesa <fex>in her article</fex>.
Sometimes, children may <fex>later</fex> put into words a memory from early life, but not customarily.
John Ryan voiced concerns <fex>in Parliament</fex> about the suggestion that somehow the inquiry was not independent.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: World Countries or Provinces of Thailand
Art of Science: World on the Head of a Pin
